qas.question: Who designed the City Island Historical Society and Nautical Museum's building?
What was the City Island Historical Society and Nautical Museum's building originally?
Where is the NY Maritime College?
Which river is near the New York Botanical Gardens?

context: The peninsular borough's maritime heritage is acknowledged in several ways.The City Island Historical Society and Nautical Museum occupies <a1_0>a former public school<a1_0/> designed by the New York City school system's turn-of-the-last-century master architect <a0_0>C. B. J. Snyder<a0_0/>. The state's Maritime College in <a2_0>Fort Schuyler<a2_0/> (on the southeastern shore) houses the Maritime Industry Museum. In addition, <a3_0>the Harlem River<a3_0/> is reemerging as "Scullers' Row" due in large part to the efforts of the Bronx River Restoration Project, a joint public-private endeavor of the city's parks department. Canoeing and kayaking on the borough's namesake river have been promoted by the <a4_0>Bronx River<a4_0/> Alliance. The river is also straddled by the New York Botanical Gardens, its neighbor, the Bronx Zoo, and a little further south, on the west shore, Bronx River Art Center.
